title: Professional Communication: Business Writing and Storytelling
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Professional Communication: Business Writing and Storytelling is an online short course from The Economist designed to help business professionals attract and address broad audiences across various written formats. Based on the newspaper’s editorial practice, this six-week course offers a self-reflective journey through the craft and purpose of writing and storytelling, equipping you with the confidence to communicate with partners and employees. An accessible “tools not rules” approach to grammar unlocks practical skills for constructing cohesive sentences and paragraphs, and shows how elements such as word choice, punctuation and structure can maximise impact and clarity. You’ll also explore ways to source information accurately, learn to strengthen arguments with data visualisations, and uncover methods for constructive and collaborative editing.

Enjoy a free three-month digital subscription with this executive-education course from The Economist. Read daily articles on Economist.com, listen to our podcasts, watch videos, browse newsletters, immerse yourself in our app or join us at exclusive events.

,

,

what_will_learn: ['An understanding of the importance and impact of professionally written content|', 'Practical writing, editing and data-visualisation skills for creating clear and compelling business communications|', 'A writer’s toolkit based on The Economist’s editorial approach, helping you to navigate questions of structure, word choice and style|', 'The ability to source, structure and convey information in a way that is accurate, engaging and ethical|', 'Insights into the craft and psychology of writing, designed to help you become a more self-reflective writer|']
target_students: This course will benefit anyone seeking to improve their business writing and storytelling abilities| Participants who are looking to communicate with more conviction will learn how to craft narratives that hook and convince their readers, whether they are employees, partners or clients| Individuals will gain practical skills in sourcing, writing and editing content, and in the effective use of data visualisation|This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies| The course has an estimated 50 hours of learning| Note: should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon them| The Economist and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points|
instructor|2|designation: Lecturer in Corporate Communication, Intercultural Communication, Diversity and Reputation Management, UCT
review|1|review: “The content was specific and useful. It provided insight and instruction and was specific to the task and modules. The online learning experience was very enjoyable. Nawaal was extremely helpful, and Lesley provided insightful and extremely useful feedback, which enabled greater understanding [...]. I have an enhanced understanding and awareness of the best practices and have gained valuable and applicable knowledge, thanks to the material and Lesley’s feedback. Consequently, I have a far better understanding of the intricacies involved and the pitfalls that need to be avoided. It has also helped to clearly illustrate areas of my skill set that require improvement, and where my weaknesses are. Meeting and networking with my classmates has been a pleasure as I’ve been exposed to a very diverse pool of knowledge and insight, which has been extremely valuable to me.”
short_description: Learn how to craft accurate, engaging and impactful pieces of writing for the business context.
additional_pricing_details: You can pay your course fees before the course starts, or you may opt for a split payment plan on courses that are nine weeks and shorter. For courses 10 weeks and longer, there is a three-part payment plan available.

title: Copy-editing
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

The effectiveness of any published piece of writing can be significantly enhanced by the work of a skilled copy-editor. It’s the editor’s job to ensure that written material is clear, concise, compelling and error free, and the University of Cape Town (UCT) Copy-editing online short course is designed to prepare you for this task.

Guided by an expert, you’ll learn how to apply the complex rules of grammar, restructure text for improved flow, and correct errors through proofreading. You’ll also discover more about book editing and working with authors, and you’ll improve your knowledge of the book publishing process.

Armed with the ability to critically review copy, you’ll have the foundation to become an invaluable asset to any company that works with words.

,

,

review|1|review: As a graphic design newbie, this course provided me with an overview of all aspects of graphic design. The course is full of useful information, tips, guidelines, advice, and so much more! It’s enough to make you excited to learn more and dive into your own field of design. The course tutor is really an expert in the field of graphic design (and other design fields), and gave such excellent feedback on design assignments. I highly recommend taking the course.

title: Graphic Design
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

Most organisations will, at some point, require the skills of a graphic designer. Professionals in this field play an integral role in enhancing a brand’s visual presence, and are highly valued for their ability to convey meaning through visual elements.

This Graphic Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will provide you with the technical skills and creative knowledge needed to make a start in this profession. Guided by a media expert, you’ll develop a basic understanding of how to use Adobe Illustrator,* learn to work with digital images, and explore how to choose effective typefaces to create compelling content for both print and web platforms. As you gain design knowledge and proficiency in the relevant software, you’ll also learn more about the business of graphic design and how to create a professional portfolio.

*GetSmarter won’t provide the software needed for this course; you’ll be responsible for ensuring you have access to it.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Most organisations will, at some point, require the skills of a graphic designer. Professionals in this field play an integral role in enhancing a brand’s visual presence, and are highly valued for their ability to convey meaning through visual elements.

As you gain design knowledge and proficiency in the relevant software, you’ll also learn more about the business of graphic design and how to create a professional portfolio.

,

]

title: Higher Education Teaching Certificate
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

Engage with effective postsecondary education teaching methods in this online short course, inspired by the in-person seminar program currently offered by Harvard’s Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning. The Harvard Bok Higher Education Teaching Certificate gives you the opportunity to reflect on your practices, portfolio, and teaching journey in this field. You’ll be exposed to the most relevant research on how students learn, and discover how to apply this insight in your own teaching context.

Study pedagogical approaches through the lens of the higher education environment, including student engagement and classroom management. Use this opportunity to investigate reflective teaching methods and update your skills by adopting a more conscious, collaborative, and refined approach to your third-level education teaching practice.

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Engage with effective postsecondary education teaching methods in this online short course, inspired by the in-person seminar program currently offered by Harvard’s Derek Bok Center for Teaching and Learning. The Harvard Bok Higher Education Teaching Certificate gives you the opportunity to reflect on your practices, portfolio, and teaching journey in this field. You’ll be exposed to the most relevant research on how students learn, and discover how to apply this insight in your own teaching context.

,

Study pedagogical approaches through the lens of the higher education environment, including student engagement and classroom management. Use this opportunity to investigate reflective teaching methods and update your skills by adopting a more conscious, collaborative, and refined approach to your third-level education teaching practice.

]

title: Teaching With Technology
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks

As a result of accelerated global change, the integration of technology and education has become increasingly widespread. To excel in a modern classroom setting and the fast-evolving pedagogical landscape, educators need to adapt to new teaching and learning approaches to provide their students with an enhanced experience.

Discover how to incorporate technology into your classroom activities, lesson plans, and teaching strategies on the Teaching With Technology online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). Guided by industry expert and associate professor Joanne Hardman, you’ll discover the history of technology as a teaching aid and develop the ability to initiate a pedagogical transformation using technology in your environment.

Explore highly practical and theoretical applications as you gain the tools you need to deliver excellent education to your students at every educational phase. Apply these learnings, not only in times of disruption, but throughout your career.

,

,

title: Business Writing
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

Whether you’re still building your career or you’re already growing a company of your own, effective business writing is a crucial skill for anyone who wants to get ahead.

The Business Writing online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will help you to develop and refine your professional communication skills in order to convey your ideas clearly and with impact. Arm yourself with a powerful toolkit for securing future business and career opportunities by learning to create well-thought-out, written and formatted professional documents that will get you noticed.

Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll gain the ability to write for a range of business needs, including writing CVs and business plans, as well as comprehensive proposals, legal documents, reports, and professional emails.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

title: Web Design
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the virtual face of a company, websites are a key component of many businesses’ marketing and operating strategies. For this reason, organisations across industries value the skills of professionals who can create engaging web pages that set the company’s brand apart from the crowd.

The Web Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) introduces you to the building blocks of web design, and aims to equip you with the theoretical knowledge and practical skills to build a strong online presence for yourself or your company. You’ll develop a basic understanding of coding languages and discover how to test and publish online pages that render across devices.

Throughout the course, you’ll apply your learnings to produce a four-page website, and have the chance to present your work to peers for feedback in a series of group ‘crit’ sessions. You’ll walk away with the confidence to start your career in the growing field of web design.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

As the virtual face of a company, websites are a key component of many businesses’ marketing and operating strategies. For this reason, organisations across industries value the skills of professionals who can create engaging web pages that set the company’s brand apart from the crowd.

,

,

target_students: This introductory course is designed for working professionals who want to remain relevant in the competitive digital age| Equally, it’s suited to anyone eager to change career direction or upskill in tasks related to web design, graphic design, art direction, and digital marketing| Individuals with existing web design experience can validate their skills with a UCT certificate of completion| Please note, students will be responsible for the purchase of their own domain names for this course|
instructor|1|designation: Senior Lecturer of Media Studies and Production, University of Cape Town
review|1|review: The biggest lesson I learnt was to think less (and to ‘show’ rather than ‘tell’) when it comes to writing – it is the only way to be truly original – you can check facts and grammar later – just get it out there, onto paper, and then go back and use a bit of common sense – don’t think, just write!
short_description: Learn the foundations of web design, and grow the confidence to structure, create, and maintain an original and responsive website.
additional_pricing_details: You can pay your course fees before the course starts, or you may opt for a split payment plan on courses that are nine weeks and shorter. For courses 10 weeks and longer, there is a three-part payment plan available.

title: Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) has evolved extensively over time. Along with advancements in technology, HCI has the potential to transform our experience with machines by creating simpler, more powerful, and intuitive digital experiences.

The Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design online short course from the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) helps you reflect on the current state of user and computer interaction. Eight experts from MIT CSAIL have dedicated their research efforts to exploring the ways in which HCI can be enhanced, and they’re opening that research up to you through this online course so you can apply it for improved user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design.

Guided by their industry insight, you’ll have the opportunity to imagine the future of HCI by reflecting on non-traditional interaction, speech recognition, and rapid prototyping, among others. Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll examine real-world applications of technology aimed at bettering UX and UI design, as you take your understanding beyond interface by integrating future-focused HCI into your work.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

,

Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll examine real-world applications of technology aimed at bettering UX and UI design, as you take your understanding beyond interface by integrating future-focused HCI into your work.

]

title: Instructional Design
description:
[

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

The evolution of the modern workplace – including the rapid progression of technical and environmental disruption – has made the upskilling and reskilling of employees a vital concern for organisations worldwide.1 These changes have increased the need for learning opportunities that address the specific requirements of businesses. At the same time, it’s heightened the demand for those with the skills to create and implement engaging, effective learning material.

The Instructional Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) gives you the tools to create effective learning experiences and embrace a new role as an agent of change. Gain a holistic understanding of the fundamental principles of instructional design, including content curation and using learning management platforms, with a focus on African and emerging-market contexts. On the course, you’ll learn to use incentivisation tactics, particularly gamification, to achieve learning goals. You’ll also explore the links between instructional design and organisational goals, and build a portfolio of transformative instructional design work that applies directly to your current context.

1 World Economic Forum (Oct, 2020).

,

Duration: 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

,

Gain a holistic understanding of the fundamental principles of instructional design, including content curation and using learning management platforms, with a focus on African and emerging-market contexts. On the course, you’ll learn to use incentivisation tactics, particularly gamification, to achieve learning goals. You’ll also explore the links between instructional design and organisational goals, and build a portfolio of transformative instructional design work that applies directly to your current context.

,

title: User Experience Design
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

Ease of use is now a vital feature of an effective digital environment. For a website or app to holistically serve its purpose, it needs to offer customers a seamless, intuitive user experience (UX).

The University of Cape Town (UCT) User Experience Design online short course enables you to understand how users interact with online content so that you can design environments that meet their evolving needs. You’ll discover key UX research and design techniques, and learn how to work with stakeholders, run user tests, design wireframes, and develop prototypes. You’ll also analyse current trends in the field, and map out a professional journey for yourself so that you can better leverage your new skills to launch a career in UX.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

You’ll also analyse current trends in the field, and map out a professional journey for yourself so that you can better leverage your new skills to launch a career in UX.

]

title: Teaching Certificate: The Science of Social and Emotional Learning
description:
[

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

In an increasingly fast-changing and diverse world, the role of social and emotional skills is more important than ever. Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) provides a foundation for positive, long-term effects in children, adults, and communities. People with strong social-emotional skills are better able to cope with everyday challenges and benefit academically, professionally, and socially.

The Teaching Certificate: The Science of Social and Emotional Learning* from Northwestern University’s School of Education and Social Policy will give you the tools to effectively plan classroom experiences that promote self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship-building, and decision-making through an equity and trauma-informed lens. Throughout this online short course, you’ll learn how SEL can help mitigate stress, anxiety, and trauma while promoting well-being and improved social awareness. With an in-depth look at the key concepts of SEL, you’ll learn how to enhance the teaching and learning experience in your classroom practices.

Over six weeks, you’ll develop a plan to implement SEL techniques in your educational context as you work towards earning a certificate of completion from a highly ranked education school.

* This online short course does not constitute licensure.

,

Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

People with strong social-emotional skills are better able to cope with everyday challenges and benefit academically, professionally, and socially.

,

The Teaching Certificate: The Science of Social and Emotional Learning* from Northwestern University’s School of Education and Social Policy will give you the tools to effectively plan classroom experiences that promote self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship-building, and decision-making through an equity and trauma-informed lens. Throughout this online short course, you’ll learn how SEL can help mitigate stress, anxiety, and trauma while promoting well-being and improved social awareness. With an in-depth look at the key concepts of SEL, you’ll learn how to enhance the teaching and learning experience in your classroom practices.

,

Over six weeks, you’ll develop a plan to implement SEL techniques in your educational context as you work towards earning a certificate of completion from a highly ranked education school.

,

* This online short course does not constitute licensure.

]

title: Feature Journalism
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

The rise of online content marketing and brand journalism has ignited the demand for professionals who produce quality content that is accurate, informative, and generates readership. The University of Cape Town’s (UCT) Feature Journalism online short course equips you with the skills needed to research, write, and sell your features to a variety of publications. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll refine and enhance your writing skills as you become a better journalist and build towards your writing career.

This highly practical online course explores the development of feature stories, research methods, and interview techniques, amongst other essential content elements such as language, structure, and editing methods. Navigate the legal aspects and ethical implications of journalism, and discover best practices for working with editors. Throughout the course you’ll produce your own 2000-word feature article, guided and reviewed by the award-winning journalist André Wiesner.1

1 André Wiesner (Nd.) Accessed 2019.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,

Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll refine and enhance your writing skills as you become a better journalist and build towards your writing career.

,

This highly practical online course explores the development of feature stories, research methods, and interview techniques, amongst other essential content elements such as language, structure, and editing methods. Navigate the legal aspects and ethical implications of journalism, and discover best practices for working with editors. title: Digital Photography
description:
[

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

Images are a powerful way to immortalise moments and tell compelling stories. Whether you plan to draw on photography in a personal or professional capacity, these skills are a valuable addition to your repertoire of competencies.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Digital Photography online short course introduces you to the features and functionalities of digital SLR cameras, and teaches you how to use different settings to take high-quality images under a range of conditions. You’ll also discover the principles of composition, and learn basic photo-editing techniques.

During the course, you’ll apply what you learn practically to produce a range of images, and you’ll benefit from ongoing constructive feedback from your head tutor, professional photographer Roberta Crumplin.

,

Duration: 10 weeks (excluding orientation)

,
